channel.title: Can't ping computer! PLEASE HELP
channel.description:
[size=24pt][b]Hello, I recently coded a 317 server, but people are having difficulties logging onto it. I have set up a No-Ip which works, and I portforwarded, but I receive this error when checking to see my ports availability.[/b][/size]
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2nges8x.png[/img]
[b][i][size=18pt]PLEASE HELP![/size][/i][/b]

item.title: Can't ping computer! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @pumaking pumaking
item.description:
@pumaking wrote:

@attk mast3r Can you please dumb that down a bit? I tried turing off the firewall, but that didn’t work.

@loveandpower In order for me to portfoward on my router, Portfoward.com made me set up a static ip address.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't ping computer! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @attk_mast3r attk mast3r
item.description:
@attk_mast3r wrote:

Routers nowadays typically have DoS protection, which blocks ping from untrusted sources unless you allow it. try temporarily turning off your firewall, start with the computer’s firewall then the router’s firewall. If that is the problem you’ll need to allow all processes that the server uses though the firewall, most likely on the OS firewall. If that’s not is Loveandpower mentioned dynamic IP, ISPs will have a lease time when it comes to your IP, meaning it will change every so often, make sure your IP is still the same.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

do you have a dynamic ip?
